instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't charge
threads.message:
Without the battery everything works perfectly, The battery doesn't charge if the laptop is connected to power, however it will be recognized in OS and charge if after the laptop has already been turned on you connect the battery to the mainboard.

The current sensing and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> are all working fine.

Where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't charge
threads.message: Still sounds like a current sense issue. Did you check resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28? <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> is also suspect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't charge
